# Introduction

------------------------------------------------------------------------

<ul>

<li>**Rstudio** (soon to be **posit**) includes several ways to render documents into PDF/Office \[PowerPoint, Word\] and HTML files</li>

<ul>

::: fragment
<li>**Limited** by your familiarity with Markdown, $\LaTeX$, & patience for wrangling dev environment up-front</li>
:::

::: fragment
<li>**Benefits** include instant value updating, quick porting of new presentations, high possibility for templates (especially for partials). No more `_final_finalFinal.docx`</li>
:::

</ul>

<li>**Exploring** submitting the initial document for Plan Team as an HTML</li>

</ul>

## LenComps ‚ùå

::: columns
::: {.column width="40%"}
<font size = "5"> $\Sigma_{year,sex,length}Nhauls_{year,sex}\times p_{sex,length+\delta}log(\hat p_{sex, length})$

Where $\delta$ is a small number less than 1 added to account for the possibility of zero observations in a length category. The weights ($Nhauls$) are shown in the table below.
:::

::: {.column width="60%"}
| Year | Nhauls |
|------|--------|
| 2015 | 55     |
| 2016 | 27     |
| 2017 | 76     |
| 2018 | 57     |
| 2019 | 44     |
:::
:::
